Posts.Content: Apr 1, 2012 07:49PM bayareamom wrote: Hi PamCA I started out every other week. My MO thought that since I am young and was healthy that I wouldn't be a problem for me. It was a problem. I had a difficult time getting my blood back to a normal level with such a short time inbetween treatments. I got sick with neutropenic fever twice. So then we decided to space them out to every three weeks. It has been somewhat better but then this last time I got a cold and it got really bad because my defenses were down. There are pros and cons to both schedules. Good luck. Jeanne
Posts.Title: Differences in Side Effects PamCA claireinaz

Posts.Content: Mar 9, 2012 06:31PM - edited Mar 9, 2012 06:32PM by bayareamom Thanks for the photos! All of you look amazing and give me a lot of hope. I thought that being bald and wearing different wigs would some how be fun but I don't find it fun at all. I can't wait to get hair back. I'm just a month away of being done with taxol (two more!). Can't wait to leave this behind. Lovely forum!
Posts.Title: What a difference a year makes jennyboog Yndorian

Posts.Content: May 5, 2014 11:12PM bayareamom wrote: I disagree with Lilly.  I had delayed reconstruction and have lovely results.  My doctors thought I wold need radiation and told me I would need to delay.  i was not sure I wanted to reconstruct, anyway.  But after all was said and done, I did want to have the reconstruction.  My plastic surgeon thinks he gets his best results with delayed.  I am very pleased with the outcome.
